item.title: Tysons Corner Gets Wireless Network Connections
item.description:
Washington D.C., a major hub for technology in government, military, and business, has been a key market for XO Communication’s competitive network services. Their newest offering is high-capacity broadband wireless for the Tysons Corner area of Virginia, with speeds ranging from 10 Mbps to 1 Gbps for various services including VoIP, Ethernet, and private lines. This surpasses WiFi capabilities, offering speeds from 10 Mbps to 1 Gbps, exceeding what’s available through standard consumer wireless options like WiFi and WiMAX...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/tysons-corner-gets-wireless-network-connections/

item.title: LMDS Fills the Fiber Gap
item.description:
Although fiber optic bandwidth is widely available across the country, connecting businesses to this network over the “last mile” is a different story. It’s surprising to realize that less than 20% of commercial buildings are equipped for fiber optic telecommunications services. This is primarily due to the high cost of installing fiber optic cables, a process that’s difficult to justify when businesses already have access to telephone and data services through existing copper lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lmds-fills-the-fiber-gap/
